rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/165.127.8.254|165.127.8.254]] to last version by 81.156.22.200 ([[WP:HG|HG]])
Moved a paragraph sections on Fascist economics
That section should be presented elsewhere.
/* Interventionist social policies */ eugenics belongs to national socialism, not fascism
opposition to general libealism more important
it is still debatable for Nazism many prominent scholars disagree with Aly.
/* National socialism and national syndicalism */ minor punctuation correction
they opposed classical liberals, which liberalism meant at the time. mussolini's welfare state policies were what today is called social liberal.
/* Totalitarianism */ Added quotation about Fascist totalitarianism
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 243028427 by [[Special:Contributions/Valois bourbon|Valois bourbon]] ([[User talk:Valois bourbon|talk]]) Italian Fascism DECLARES itself to be totalitarian
italian fascism was dictatorial but not totalitarian; it was not much more social interventionist than other countries at the time
the source talks about nazis not fascists
Fascists not only opposed communists and Marxists, they opposed all forms of internationalist socialism, arresting or killing social democrats.
Removed a mistaken point, the only "socialism" that fascism endorsed was "national socialism" and that is much different from regular socialism
Moved religion and racism subsections out of "core tenets" and made them separate sections on their own
Reorganized section as defined in the body of the article
Added reference for info on how fascism opposed international socialism
/* Class collaboration */ Making tenses match, from "creating" to "create"
/* Corporatism */ Fixing typo, from "inbetween" to "in between"
/* Nationalism */ Fixing typo, from "Fascism see" to "Fascism sees"
/* Post-war misusage */ Fixing typo, from "has" to "has been"
/* Political spectrum */ Correcting typo, from "overtime" to "over time"
/* Core tenets */ Interventionist social policies were largely totalitarian in nature
/* Corporatism */ Added information on the mixed economy promoted by fascism
Mentions not only Hitler and Mussolini's support of corporatism but Irish fascists' endorsement of corporatism
/* Core tenets */ Moved section up on the list because it is highly important as a tenet of fascism
/* Positions on religion */ Correcting citations to correct page and correct source.
Added quote showing Mussolini declaring Italian Fascism to be on the political right
Removed "divisions" heading. Neither helpful nor entirely accurate.
/* Positions on religion */ Payne - weakening of religion necessary for fascism to take root.
/* Positions on religion */ Fascism as an essentially modern, secular, and post-religious ideology.
Added corporatism, as this was a key element of fascist economics
Not all scholars agree that socialism is an integral part of fascism
No, it is not a "nationalistic socialistic" ideology, only Nazism claimed that, Italian Fascism rejected socialism in its entirety, promoting class collaboration and opposing class war
/* Ku Klux Klan */ Not much support that klan is fascist. Consensus is against inclusion. See talk.
/* Para-fascism and commonly alleged fascist ideologies */
/* Positions on religion */ There is no firm position by fascism on religion, so fascists' position on religion is not a common core tenet of fascism itself
/* Nationalism and nationalist-oriented collectivism, class collaboration, and populism */
Fascism does allow national socialism or national syndicalism which sees to organize the working class to the nation, but fascism does not allow common international socialism
Fascism opposes internationalist socialism more commonly known as international socialism which rejects nationalism and pushes for class unity across national, cultural, and ethnic lines
Mussolini disavowed his earlier socialism by the time he formed fascism, he repeatedly criticized socialism of being a failure
If it is a "POV" to point out that some critics of fascism say fascism is on the social right, then it is just as much a POV to declare that fascism in no way is associated with the radical right
Disputed whether or not fascism is genuinely socialist, it opposes class division but offers national unity across class lines as the solution rather than the victory of an economic class by itself.
/* Para-fascism and commonly alleged fascist ideologies */ Remove Peronism, see talk
/* Interventionist social policies */ parenthetical deining psuedoscience is unnecessary
/* Interventionist social policies */Minor reword to better reflect source
/* Interventionist social policies */Delete unsourced POV addition re political spectrum of fascist social policy.
Opposition to conservatism, again. (Please stop the disruptive editing, this is very well sourced and is the academic consensus).
/* Positions on religion */ Remove weasel words "many scholars believe". It is not something "many scholars believe". It is a demonstrable fact and heavily sourced.
/* Positions on religion */ missing word - concentration "camp" & minor change adding introductory clause to sentance
/* Para-fascism and commonly alleged fascist ideologies */
/* Commonly alleged fascist ideologies and para-fascism */changed subtitle to "Para-fascism and commonly alleged fascist ideologies"
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/71.192.116.68|71.192.116.68]] to last version by R-41 ([[WP:HG|HG]])
/* Mobutism */ Made a grammar correction to previous edit
Moved information on common traits to an earlier position in the article
fascism is conservative in nature. passage can cause confusion.
/* Commonly alleged fascist ideologies and para-fascism */
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/69.147.10.1|69.147.10.1]] to last version by 99.150.208.157 ([[WP:HG|HG]])
rv back superior and better organized one, the other one listed ideologies that were not fascist,
chalmers is a scholar, and the relationship between Neo-nazis and the KKK is undeniable
/* Nazism (National Socialism) */ rephrased sentence, typos in citations
- peronism: has nothing to do with fascism
/* Ku Klux Klan */ the only reference that even remotely links it to fascism is from a non-scholar
/* Commonly alleged fascist ideologies and para-fascism */ peronism
decided to remove them, neither are agreed upon core tenets that united the fascist ideologies
/* Commonly alleged fascist ideologies and para-fascism */ peronism
/* Positions on religion */ No current POV dispute.
Nazism is does not refer to those other movements
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 240248254 by [[Special:Contributions/204.82.246.119|204.82.246.119]] ([[User talk:204.82.246.119|talk]]) Removed page vandlism
/* Integralism */ I think "party's" not "parties" is meant.
broad statement, Encylopedia Britannica differs on this
put back text that was removed for no reason
this is the more correct term
stop removing cited material and putting the entire Italian Fascism article in the section.
removed more aggressive posting from sockpuppet. when will he stop poping up and changing the census.
/* Rexism */ Rexism incredibly minor movement, source associates it with national socialism, not deserving of its own section

remove national socialist specific sub-movements (Hungary, etc), [[nazism]] has its own article for this and even its own subsection here. this is about all of fascism. kkk nothing to do with fascism.
updating link, possibly some formatting/rephrasings, using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
updating link, possibly some formatting/rephrasings, using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Falangism */ Changed title to "Early Falangism". Later Falangism wasn't fascist - per sources later in that section.

[[WP:AES|]]Replaced content with 'Fascism is a belief that states moneys have the right to vote and reproduce with chimps.'
updating link, possibly some formatting/rephrasings, using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
reducing to the three most basic oppositions
/* Economic policies */ this talks about specific policies of Italian Fascist before 1925 and this is a general article
updating link, possibly some formatting/rephrasings, using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
updating link, possibly some formatting/rephrasings, using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
anti-communism was the main "anti" of fascism
This level of detail doesn't belong in an intro
Sources don't qualify the conservatism which fascism opposes as "reactionary". I've never seen it phrased that way in any of the sources which addres the fascist negations.

put in sentence that shows that he section does just talk about parafascist interwar movements. The title also has "commonly alleged fascism ideologes" in it too.
